creator: praveen_s@yahoo.com
text:
A log replay option would be very helpful in running load tests simulating the
actual production scenario. Currently we have written a small tool that we use
to read the access log and replay it exactly as the way it happened in
production. This helps us to determine how our servers will behave given the
characteristics of the load.

I am not aware of any tool that is available today in the market either
commercial or open source that can do this. Servers do not exhibit the same
behavior as they do in production while running a bunch of predetermined
requests. Replaying the log as it happened helps in reproducing problems and
also determining potential problems.

At the least, we should be able to feed a access log to JMeter and JMeter should
be able to use those requests to run the load. Our tool that we have written
covers two scenarios or has two features.

1. Run n number of requests continuosly every second. This simulates n number of
requests/sec.

2. Replay the requests in the access log based on the timestamp. If n requests
are available in the access log for ss:mm:hh, play those requests at ss:mm:hh.
This simulates a actual production load as it happened and when it happened. We
could start the requests at ss:mm:hh or we could start the requests from the top
of the access log but replayed at the same interval and number of requests/second.

Hope will will have atleast the first feature in JMeter if not for the second.

text:
please give the access log sampler a try. it supports tomcat common log format 
currently. when I get time, I plan to support other popular log formats. if 
you're using a server that doesn't match the common log format, you can write 
your own parser and drop it in. if you run into problems, please feel free to 
email me directly.
